result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin A Smits was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Huber with standard release conditions.
-Sentence credit of 45 days is granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
-Cash bail of $150.00 applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

-Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment, and/or counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

-No violent contact with victim listed in the criminal complaint. 
-Mental Health Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. 
-Case 22CM1267 is dismissed and read-in. 
-If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
3:36 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane.
Defendant Kevin A Smits in court, in custody.  Attorney Christopher Scott Carson in court for Kevin A Smits. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1. 
Court find the defendant guilty to Count 1. 
Court dismisses and reads in case 22CM1267.

Court orders the following:
90 DAYS  Waukesha County Jail with Huber, all standard release conditions.
45 Days credit if revoked
STAYED for PROBATION

Term of Probation: 1 YEAR
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
No VIOLENT contact with:  victim listed in the criminal complaint
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

COSTS:  $243.00
D/V SURCHARGE: $100.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Any monies on deposit to be applied toward fine/fee/surcharge.
